title.rendered: 11 Mobile App Development Trends To Look In 2024

content.rendered:
Following the mobile app development trends are very crucial for every business and in 2024, it’s a must. But before we talk about that, let’s see what is the role of smartphones for businesses.

Smartphones have become an inseparable part of our daily lives. Waking up with a morning alarm, using Whatsapp, listening to music, reading News, watching YouTube videos, checking emails, updating project status, and so on.

Everything is seamlessly executed from mobile apps installed on our mobile devices. Currently, 2.1 Billion people worldwide own a Smartphone and according to TouchPoints report.

Adults aged 25 plus use their  phone about 264 times a day, including texts and calling . For people aged 15-24, the number is 387 times every day. If average sleeping time for this age group is taken 10 hours, this equates to some sort of Smartphone activity every other minute.

This is unbelievable yet true. Hence, the use of Smartphone and mobile applications are not going to get reduced in 2024-25 anyways. Only mobile app trends might show new colors. In this blog post, we are going to discuss the current mobile app development trends that you need to look forward to in 2024.

After thorough research at ValueCoders, our team found 11 such mobile app trends that are going to be popular in the upcoming year. Here are they:

11 Mobile App Development Trends

1) Accelerated Mobile Pages (AMP) Is Changing Web App Landscape:

It’s been over 4 years since Google started the AMP Project. Apart from that, Google also announced that there will be a separate search index for the mobile web. This revolutionary step changed the mobile app development trends completely, especially from an SEO and Web app perspective.

Google AMP-supported web apps load much faster on mobile devices and reduce the bounce rate by a large percentage. It also benefits publishers with increased ad visibility and more visitors. Hence, along with PWAs introduced by Google introduced in I/O 2017, AMP will certainly be one of the top mobile app development trends in the coming year. So, hiring an app developer can be a wise decision if you are planning to do a project in the mobile app industry this year.

2) AR & VR Will Show Some Magic

If you are a little aware of modern mobile app development trends, then Augmented Reality(AR) and Virtual Reality(VR) apps will be nothing new for you. In 2021, AR & VR  have been revolutionary in the gaming and entertainment industry. Games like Pokemon Go, iOnRoad, Sky Siege, and myNav are bright examples of AR games whereas VR devices like Samsung Gear VR, Google Cardboard, and Oculus Rift are gaining popularity.

 3) Artificial Intelligence Is Real Now

As per research from Gartner in 2019, there was a 300% increase in investment in artificial intelligence last year compared to 2018. Through the use of advanced analytics, cognitive interfaces into complex systems, and machine learning techs, AI will provide business users access to powerful insights never before available to them.

Due to these advantages, big bees like Google, IBM, eBay, Facebook have started acquiring startups those adept in Artificial Intelligence and machine learning. This graph will tell you more.

 

Some of the best AI apps of today, such as the Google Assistant are a result of intelligence acquired through many startup acquisitions.

4) Cloud-Driven Mobile Apps Are Rising

From customers to tech professionals, everyone has heard about cloud technology and how it’s impacting our collective lives. Today, cloud computing has finally found its place with mobile apps. Now, we’re seeing powerful mobile apps that directly fetch data from the cloud and take minimum space in a smartphone’s internal memory.

Google Drive, Dropbox, & OneDrive are only the tip of the iceberg. According to a Cisco research report, cloud apps drove 90% of total mobile data traffic by the end of 2019, and Mobile cloud traffic was 11-fold with a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 60%. 5) Enterprise Apps Will Advance Further

The Prime goal of an enterprise mobile app is to help you restructure, streamline and manage crucial business processes on the go. Whereas micro-app aims to suffice very targeted operations and takes less load. Hiring an app developer can assist you with this. However, both are successfully accomplishing their endeavors and are expected to continue further.

An example of enterprise mobile apps can be Evernote. The Evernote app helps teams collaborate on projects from their mobile devices. On the other hand, Facebook messenger or any to-do list app are good examples of micro-apps that concentrate on only one task.

A study by Adobe in 2019 reported that 77% of business owners found enterprise apps advantageous & 66% are increasing their investment further. Adobe expected the enterprise app market to be valued at somewhere around the US $430 billion by 2021.

6) More Focus On Security In Apps

As per a Gartner prediction, 75% of mobile apps would not pass even basic security tests. In support, an HP study states that 70.6% of apps can access external storage and 94.7% of apps include logging methods. These surveys majorly indicate the following concerns:

Hackers will tend to continue with the trend of exploiting known security gaps in mobile apps for stealing sensitive and confidential information. This is one of the negative mobile app development trends that is going to continue this year, most notably in android app development. However, some JavaScript frameworks can help you develop a secure and scalable mobile application.

7) Wearable Devices Are Getting Attention

According to International Data Corporation (IDC),  the market for wearable devices is going to experience a composite annual growth rate (CAGR) of 20.3%, leading to 213.6 million units shipped in 2020. We saw some amazing wearable devices this year from the likes of Apple, Huawei, and Samsung.

Innovative Healthcare application development technologies will expand healthcare beyond traditional methods. These devices show that it’s way beyond getting restricted to only the healthcare industry and prove to be one of the promising mobile app development trends in 2019.

8) M-Commerce Is Becoming A New Standard

These days, instead of using Credit/Debit cards, a considerable number of customers are preferring to make purchases through Google Pay and Apple Pay. This is giving a push to m-commerce.

Wearable devices are also pushing m-Commerce and making the process more intuitive for people. Beyond predictive analytics and data collection, the wearable market will also play a major role in the future of M-commerce and customer loyalty.

Read More: 11 Tips For Successful Mobile App Development For Business

9) Internet of Things Will Be Much Bigger

The rapid adoption of cloud-based apps brings us to one of the latest mobile app development trends that piqued mobile developer interest in 2021 – the Internet of Things or IoT.

A per reports from IDC, spending on IoT is expected to reach up to $745 billion in 2020, and surpass $22 Billion by 2022! This directly impacts the mobile app trends as IoT devices are majorly controlled by Smartphones. In fact, companies such as Microsoft are orienting their complete app ecosystems around IoT and various use cases enabled with its application.

Therefore IoT is definitely going to stay in 2024 as a major trend.

10) Beacons & Location-Based Services Are on the rise

Integrated location-based service applications like Apple’s iBeacons and Google Beacon are already popular. Wi-Fi usage will no longer be limited to hotels, restaurants, retail outlets, and health care. The usage of applications with Wi-Fi support rising beyond these traditional requirements.

Here’s how a beacon works:

This advanced technology gives a major scope to personalized app marketing and is expected to rise in 2024 considering one of the major mobile app trends.

Also Read: 6 Ways To Decide Your Mobile App Update Frequency

11) Chatbots are the new trend

Chatbots are digital applications that simulate the human way of conversation to help users meet their requirements. There are various types of chatbots you can see: Some are in the form of virtual assistants such as Alexa, Google Assistant, Siri, and Bixby, and there are other types of chatbots you may find on websites, web apps, and the like.

Must Check: Best Chatbot Development Companies For Startups & SMEs | 2022

Chatbots are one of the top mobile app development trends in 2022 due to various reasons. One reason is the interactive conversational experience that they offer. The other is a fact that is becoming increasingly obvious to UI/UX designers and chatbot developers across the globe- The traditional app interfaces are just not enough anymore! Chatbot mobile apps offer an innovative use-case as an app interface to let users interact with businesses in a seamless, human-like manner even in the absence of humans.

Wrapping up:

When it comes to mobile app technologies, a software outsourcing company cannot possibly rely on outdated tools and trends at the development stage. 2024 so far is bursting with a host of potential and mobile app developers can enhance their skills better if they have insight into the latest mobile app development trends. If you follow the 11 trends thoroughly then it would be certainly beneficial for your business.
